description: From Middle English forstaller, forstallor, forstallar, equivalent to forestall +â€Ž -er.

definitionGroups.group: Agent noun of forestall: one who, or that which, forestalls.

entries.meaning: (chiefly historical) One who preemptively purchases goods in order to drive up their market price for resale.
(rail transport, historical) A device that overrides an automatic brake signal.
(law, archaic) One who obstructs a road, especially in order to intercept traffic.
